comments:
I am not sure how to reproduce this.  Basically, I was just trying to commit a 
change from the package explorer, and the workbench exited.  This is most 
likely an SWT problem.

Stack trace:

Do you have any additional plugins loaded (other than the Eclipse SDK)? 
Although it is possible that the SDK itself is leaking handles, it is just as 
likely that it is another plugin (i.e. if it was the SDK itslef, everyone 
would see this problem).

Yes, I have a few external plug-ins loaded (checkstyle, remote connections, 
etc.), but I've been using them for sometime and haven't had this problem 
until recently.  I wouldn't be surprised if this is not a legitimate out of 
handles error.  What's the limit on the number of widgets you can create on 
Windows XP?

I don't know the exact number but I know it is a lot. If you want to dig 
further into this, there is a leak tool, called SLEAK, available from SWT for 
tracking down leaks. Here's a link to where you can get it:

http://www.eclipse.org/swt/tools.php

You may be able to use this tool to pinpoint which plugin is leaking handles. 
Please reopen if you find it is the Platform (or if you can reproduce the 
problem without other plugins loaded).

Would the workbench exit (not crash, exit as if you had clicked File -> Exit) 
if you ran into a legitimate out of handles exception?  How many widgets can 
you create on Windows XP before you run out of handles for widgets?

Let's see if the SWT folks can shed any light on this.

It is not up to SWT to decide how the application will exit when an error is encountered.  No more handles is not a recoverable error.  The workbench can't really exit as if you did File -> Exit because it generally pops up a progress dialog etc and it can't do this because it has no more handles.

The exact number of widgets you can create depends on the platform and other factors.

One of your plugins is leaking widgets.  You need to figure where that leak is.
